title: Jose Mourinho tells Lyon president he intends to return to Premier League
text:
Mourinho has been linked with the Tottenham job (Picture: Getty)

Jose Mourinho has turned down the chance to manage Lyon, telling the club he wants to return to the Premier League.

Lyon sacked Sylvinho this week in the wake of a derby defeat to Saint-Etienne, a result which has left the French side 14th in Ligue 1.

Club president Jean-Michel Aulas was in contact with Mourinho and RMC claim the former Manchester United coach was offered the vacant manager role.

Mourinho, however, rejected the offer and told Aulas he intends to make his return to management in England.

Mourinho has set his sights on a return to England (Picture: Getty)

The former Chelsea boss’ family lives in London and Mourinho intends to be based again in England.

The news comes hot on the heels of speculation linking Mourinho to Tottenham.

Mauricio Pochettino’s future at the club is unclear after a dismal start to the season and some Tottenham players feel their manager is angling for an exit from the club.

Advertisement

Mourinho had two spells at Chelsea, Tottenham’s local rivals, but feels he could be a good fit at Spurs.

With Mourinho ruling himself out of the running to take charge at Lyon, Arsene Wenger and Laurent Blanc are now the frontrunners for the position.

Blanc is the favourite to take up the role and Aulas is expected to hold talks with the former Paris Saint-Germain boss.
